result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas James Wisti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas James Wisti

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Dated 5/14/16 from DOJ requesting documents from the file.  Faxed to DOJ this day.
Dated 4/19/16 from DOJ requesting information from the file.  Returned to DOJ this day

Defendant Nicholas James Wisti in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM41.  DE does not qualify for PD services, does not wish to have court appointed counsel.   Court instructs on DE's without counsel.  Court will accept waiver of counsel at this time.   Waive formal reading of the Criminal Complaint's, enter a plea of G to misdemeanor counts in both cases.  Court informs of plea colloquy with DE, court will accept plea, find the DE guilty of both counts.  DE will pay a fine of $50.00 and CC in each case.  Will add to current PP.  Appeal rights given to DE.
